title: Does the game recognize you're off meta?
body: Does the game give you mastery scores based on if you were being off-meta?

replies.body:
It does, in fact, if you try troll things like Rumble support or skarner adc, the game will adjust to weaker masteries, because it expects you to feed and do poorly.

If you ever DO manage to overcome those issues, the game will reward you. It's like the game's saying "Alright, well played..."

In all of those games I played Shaco Mid. I guess the client wasn't expecting it.

I got to level 6 Rumble before the mastery system adjusted itself to me doing well as Rumble support.

Secret is just spamming E since you have no mana and poking the enemy carries.

Might not work well against enemy hookers like Blitz and Thresh tough, so care.

Can't say for sure, but I kind of doubt the system adjusts significantly based on the actions of any one single player.

OTOH, if you're literally the only person playing support Rumble, I guess that might weight your influence somewhat...

I know one thing, Support Rumble gives me a good score with less effort, but to get S or higher, I would have to kill steal often.

Which the adcs might not appreciate it tough.

Your grade depends on your percentile performance compared to all others on the same champion in the same role. So if you're using a champion in an off-meta role, then you're only being compared to other people playing that champ in that role, which in the case of off-meta stuff usually means lower standards (since off-meta stuff tends to be off-meta for a reason). On the other hand though, off-meta picks are sometimes only really played by people who are confident in their ability to use the champion in the off-meta role, so occasionally the off-meta role standards are higher than you'd expect.

It's all relative to other players performances though, grading doesn't care about the absolute numbers you achieve.

what it does recognize is your position, then verifies this by a game play analysis of so called events it maps your locations and where you/opponents died and a lot of other stuff.

It compares you to other players to determine your score so ti looks at other players playing the same champ X in mid position, then at other players playing champ X if not enough data for comparison is found.

Yes. Your rank after the game is based on how well you do with your champion at the specific role. Each lane is being monitored so if you spend a lot of time on bot lane (early game) the system will register that you were playing bot. For example, if you play jungle Yasuo, your rank will be based on how well you performed on him compared with the average *jungle* Yasuo player.

I think the way champion mastery works is that it determines how good you are relative to other people playing the same champion, with Summoner's Rift's drafts mode also being compared to others in the same role.

I've had games where I did decently well as jungle Morgana, and got S/S- ranks for those games just because no one plays jungle Morgana. On the other hand, I've gotten perfect games on top lane Nautilus and gotten A ratings just because people actually play top lane Nautilus.

Pretty sure the game detects which lane and role you're playing in and grades you depending on that. I perform way above the standard and therefore get a higher grade.

The system tracks your pathing on the map and determines your score by comparing it to other people with similar pathing.  That doesn't mean people that have pathing 99% identical to yours, but it means that the game can tell if you are top, jungle, mid, bot, or support.  So if you play Janna jungle you will be compared to other people that have played Janna jungle.

Mostly from what I've seen, you all have the wrong idea. If you get picked into the ADC role and ask to switch with top, and go Riven, it will not identify you as a Bot lane Riven. Instead it looks to where you've been on the map and gives you a grade ACCORDING to the lane you were in most of the game. So, Draven supports as I've seen would most likely be an ADC, as he is AD. If there was to say a Lux ADC but bought AP, means she went support. Technically. So, to get these mastery tokens you want, you'd have to play a character into a role they aren't supposed to be played in. Such as Ahri (ACTUAL AD) bot lane, Riven support, Shyvana mid, etc. etc.
